alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 1:26PM PST until January 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected at times. Accumulations of 3 to 6 feet, locally up to 8 feet, tonight through Tuesday above 6000 feet. South to Southwest winds gusting as high as 80 mph at times. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada including Interstate 80 over Donner Pass, Highway 50 over Echo Summit and Highway 88 over Carson Pass. * WHEN...Through 4 PM PST Tuesday. Periods of heavy snow tonight through Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Strong winds could cause tree damage. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility resulting in periods of near whiteout conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will mostly be around 4500 to 5500 feet, but will gradually rise to 6500 to 7500 feet Monday, lowering back to around 4500 to 5000 feet later Monday into Tuesday. Significant travel impacts will likely persist at the higher pass levels on Monday. Strongest winds will be tonight through mid-day Monday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
